revised_title: Fluid-Lens Telescope: Reports and Observations by Royal Society Members
tldr: The article reports on the Fluid-Lens Telescope constructed for the Royal Society, with observations and evaluations from members J.F.W. Herschel, G.B. Airy, and W.H. Smyth. The telescope is found to have remarkable color dispersion and efficient aperture, making it suitable for observing nebulae and other astronomical objects. However, it is not ideal for examining bright planets due to color issues and the need for a better eyepiece design.
